Description: Shoulder sherd (with turn of neck) of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery krater; ridge at base of neck; interior: black on neck; exterior: cream slip; neck glazed; tongue frieze at top of shoulder; part of a lion to right and perhaps large floral ornament; roughly drawn rosette as fill; red paint on mane of lion and on large floral ornament; incision used for part of the outline and for details of lion, and for details of floral ornament and of rosette; below, band with added red and white stripes.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.515)
